info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 12 at 5:40PM EDT until August 12 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM EDT FOR MCDOWELL...RUTHERFORD...EASTERN HENDERSON...POLK AND SOUTHEASTERN BUNCOMBE COUNTIES... At 540 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 12 miles west of Marion to 14 miles northwest of Rutherfordton to 6 miles southwest of Columbus, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Forest City, Marion, Rutherfordton, Columbus, Black Mountain, Spindale, Tryon, Lake Lure, Old Fort and Saluda. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
